column4: Bezos offers clues to Washington Post: patience  experimentation
column5: Sept 3 Jeff Bezos  the founder of Amazon  who shocked media watchers when he agreed to buy The Washington Post  told the struggling newspaper he will guide it using the same approach that successfully shaped his e-commerce site and turned it into the world's largest online retailer.

column4: Amgen  Cytokinetics heart failure drug misses goal in study

column4: UPDATE 2-Verizon to roadshow potential record bond issue next week
column5: NEW YORK/LONDON  Sept 3 (IFR/LPC) - Verizon Communications could steal the record from Apple  for the biggest bond issue ever to hit the global markets in coming weeks  as it begins the process of raising US$50bn of bonds to pay for part of the US$130bn price take on the 45% stake in Verizon Wireless that it is buying from Vodafone.

column4: UPDATE 1-New iPhone expected as Apple asks media to Sept. 10 event
column5: SAN FRANCISCO  Sept 3 Apple Inc on Tuesday sent official invitations to a Sept. 10 event at which it is expected to unveil the latest version of the iPhone  possibly in colors other than its trademark black and white.

column4: ArQule to cut liver cancer drug dose on safety concerns
column5: Drugmaker ArQule Inc said it would lower the dose of its experimental liver cancer drug for a second time  after a late-stage trial showed that patients on the therapy were becoming more susceptible to infection.

column4: Safety committee raises concern over ArQule's liver cancer drug

column4: Timing of bullish Nokia options trades raises questions

column4: Boeing sees Brazil jet deal decided on merits  not politics
column5: WASHINGTON Boeing Co's  chances to win a $4 billion contract to sell fighter jets to Brazil should not be damaged by allegations that the United States spied on Brazil's president  the head of the aerospace company's defense unit said on Tuesday.

column4: Boeing starts production of U.S. Air Force tankers

column4: Eurocopter vows to keep U.S. plant with new deals
column5: Europe's Eurocopter is confident of winning new contracts to maintain a 325 000 square-foot factory in Mississippi  despite uncertainty over delayed U.S. proposals to develop new reconnaissance helicopters.

column4: Boeing sees decision on South Korea fighter competition in 2-3 weeks
column5: WASHINGTON Boeing Co  said it expects South Korea to complete its assessment of bids for a $7.4 billion fighter contract within weeks  and is confident its F-15 Silent Eagle offering will secure the deal.

column4: Top Poland defence group PHO attracts foreign partners
column5: KIELCE  Poland  Sept 3 Poland's top defence group PHO  favoured as a partner by foreign defence companies vying for a share of Poland's military spending spree  has signed a cooperation deal with Boeing and unveiled a prototype of a new tank with BAE Systems.

Nokia  once the undisputed leader in mobile phones  has struggled to compete against rivals' smartphones  and investors have bet heavily against the stock by selling it short. column4: CBS win squeezes Time Warner Cable's margins: analysts
column5: CBS Corp won large increases in the fees it will receive from Time Warner Cable Inc in its agreement with the cable operator that ended a month-long blackout of CBS  Showtime and other channels in key cities  analysts said.

column4: Lockheed plans to double jetliner simulator business
column5: WASHINGTON Lockheed Martin Corp  plans to double its sales of flight simulators and services for commercial jetliner pilot training to about $220 million a year in three to five years  a senior official said on Tuesday.

column4: Lockheed braces for program cuts  delays due to U.S. budget woes
column5: WASHINGTON Lockheed Martin Corp  is bracing for cuts and delays next year in major weapons programs  including a new coastal warship it builds for the U.S. Navy  unless Congress acts to reverse mandatory reductions in U.S. military spending  a top company official said Tuesday.

column4: REUTERS SUMMIT-Lockheed braces for program cuts  delays due to U.S. budget woes
column5: (For other news from Reuters Aerospace and Defense Summit  click on  http://www.reuters.com/summit/Aero13)  (Adds Navy  Pentagon statements  byline)

column4: Morgan Stanley must pay ex-trader $8 million in flap over firing: panel
column5: Two Morgan Stanley units must pay $8 million to a former energy trader  who said the firms improperly terminated him for cause  after he declined to meet with New York law enforcement authorities during an investigation  arbitrators ruled.

column4: Ellie Mae taps Morgan Stanley to oversee sale: sources
column5: NEW YORK Mortgage software company Ellie Mae  has hired Morgan Stanley  to try to sell the company  two sources familiar with the deal told Reuters on Tuesday.

column4: Ellie Mae taps Morgan Stanley to oversee sale -sources
column5: NEW YORK  Sept 3 Mortgage software company Ellie Mae has hired Morgan Stanley to try to sell the company  two sources familiar with the deal told Reuters on Tuesday.

column4: ON THE MOVE-Wells Fargo hires advisers from UBS  Morgan Stanley
column5: Sept 3 Wells Fargo & Co's U.S. brokerage has expanded its private client group with veteran advisers from rival firms Morgan Stanley Wealth Management and UBS Wealth Management Americas.

column4: Novo could see U.S. sales hurt after losing two contracts
column5: COPENHAGEN Danish drugmaker Novo Nordisk A/S has lost two contracts to supply a U.S. pharmacy group with its insulin and diabetes treatments  taking a bite out of expected earnings.

column4: UPDATE 1-Novo could see U.S. sales hurt after losing two contracts

column4: Oracle hit with major penalties in America's Cup cheating scandal
column5: San Francisco Software mogul Larry Ellison's Oracle Team USA suffered a major setback in its effort to retain the America's Cup when an international jury on Tuesday docked the team two points and kicked three sailors and one shore crew member out of the event.

column4: PetroChina supplier Wison says chairman 'assisting probe'
column5: HONG KONG/BEIJING The chairman of a Chinese oil engineering firm is helping the authorities with an unspecified investigation  the company said on Tuesday  amid a widening corruption probe into PetroChina    one of its major customers.

column5: HONG KONG  Sept 3 China oil construction company Wison Engineering Services Co Ltd said its chairman and controlling shareholder Hua Bangsong "is assisting relevant authorities" in China who are conducting an investigation after sharp falls in Wison's share price.

column4: Expert networks: thriving in Asia  away from U.S. scrutiny
column5: SINGAPORE/HONG KONG Expert networks - a matchmaking service linking investors such as hedge funds with company insiders - are under scrutiny from regulators in the United States  but are expanding across Asia  where the market for corporate intelligence is less transparent.

column4: Deals of the day -- mergers and acquisitions
column5: Sept 3 The following bids  mergers  acquisitions and disposals were reported by 2000 GMT on Tuesday:

column4: Munich Re buys weather-and-energy risk specialist
column5: FRANKFURT  Sept 3 German reinsurer Munich Re  said it had agreed to buy a business that helps manage weather risks for the energy sector from reinsurer RenaissanceRe.

column4: RPT-UPDATE 2-Telecom Italia's core owners seek to sell-sources
column5: MILAN  Sept 3 Core investors in Telecom Italia  are seeking to sell their stakes  people familiar with the situation said  a move that could leave the country's largest telecom operator open to a takeover bid.

column4: Telecom Italia's core owners seek to sell: sources
column5: MILAN Core investors in Telecom Italia  are seeking to sell their stakes  people familiar with the situation said  a move that could leave the country's largest telecom operator open to a takeover bid.

column4: Italian shareholders seek buyer for Telecom Italia stakes
column5: MILAN Core Italian shareholders in Telecom Italia  led by Mediobanca  are seeking a buyer for their stakes in the Telco holding that controls the debt-laden telecoms company by September 28  people familiar with the situation said on Tuesday.

column4: Italian shareholders seek buyer for Telecom Italia stakes
column5: MILAN  Sept 3 Core Italian shareholders in Telecom Italia  led by Mediobanca  are seeking a buyer for their stakes in the Telco holding that controls the debt-laden telecoms company by Sept. 28  people familiar with the situation said on Tuesday.

column4: Blackstone raises $5 billion for second rescue lending fund
column5: NEW YORK Blackstone Group LP  said on Tuesday it had raised $5 billion from investors for its second rescue lending fund  underscoring how alternative asset managers are looking to displace banks in providing financing to companies in distress.

column4: Turkish regulator to appoint two Turkcell board members in 1-2 weeks
column5: ISTANBUL  Sept 3 Turkey's Capital Markets Board (SPK) will appoint two members to the management board of the country's leading mobile phone company Turkcell in one to two weeks  SPK chairman Vahdettin Ertas told reporters on Tuesday.

column4: UPDATE 2-Verizon to roadshow potential record bond issue next week
column5: NEW YORK/LONDON  Sept 3 (IFR/LPC) - Verizon Communications could steal the record from Apple  for the biggest bond issue ever to hit the global markets in coming weeks  as it begins the process of raising US$50bn of bonds to pay for part of the US$130bn price take on the 45% stake in Verizon Wireless that it is buying from Vodafone.
